Description: Rim sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; creamy slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; lotus flower in added red and white and part of dot rosette in white on left; exterior: broken maeander pattern between pairs of narrow bands below rim; below, painted decoration consisting of possible figure with two spears, to left; painted inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For the inscriptions see also R. Wachter, Non-Athenian Vase Inscriptions, 215 and 217 M(2).
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 166, no. 30)

Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 279, no. 767, pl. 100)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. X, no. 6)
